comment:
IntelliJ is a powerful IDE, but its handling of third-party integrations, especially GitHub Copilot, is extremely frustrating. Many users, including myself, have experienced critical issues—for example, Copilot randomly stops working, and the only fix is to restart the entire IDE, which is highly disruptive to workflow.

However, what makes this issue even worse is the complete lack of a proper support channel. JetBrains refuses to assist, redirecting users to GitHub, but GitHub provides no issue tracker for the IntelliJ plugin. Instead, they offer only a single discussion thread, which is entirely inadequate for tracking or resolving problems.

This is unacceptable for a paid product that developers rely on daily. If GitHub and JetBrains expect users to take Copilot in IntelliJ seriously, they need to immediately create a dedicated, public issue tracker, just like the one available for the VS Code extension.

Until this is resolved, I cannot recommend IntelliJ for users who depend on Copilot, as you may find yourself stuck with no support and no way to track critical bugs. Other AI-assisted coding tools are rapidly improving, and unless JetBrains and GitHub step up their game, developers will look elsewhere.
Works great, But there is not Copilot Edits feature.

While I find inline chat useful sometimes for basic code generation, the quality of LLM is abysmal in general for the code I normally write (no web dev, performance or domain focused code that LLMs know nothing). The most annoying thing is autocomplete that looks like random text generation. I'm yet to see any sign of lucidity... Normally I should be able to disable autocomplete and I've always done that. However, in the latest version at the time of writing, I see random noisy useless autocompletions when it's totally disabled in the settings. I had to disable the plugin entirely to avoid distractions that do nothing but interrupt the flow.

With the GPT LLM, this plugin is rarely useful. The LLM appears to be willful, and tries to direct the user in how things proceed, which is quite annoying. The plugin will often deny follow-up questions by saying that it can only help with programming-related questions, but if you respond with something like "please elaborate", it will sometimes refuse, claiming that it is not a programming-related question. Next, it has a widget that supposedly allows the user to select a different LLM, but when I try to use this, and ask the plugin which LLM it is using, it invariably responds with "GPT-4o" and insists that this can't be changed. Claude is FAR better and FAR more helpful, so why have this widget if it results in no change to the LLM that is being used? This plugin often wastes more time than it saves, but since it is very occasionally helpful, I gave it 2 stars. It has some potential, and I'd consider changing my rating in the future, but for now, I would not recommend wasting your time. The version for VS Code is much better and much more capable, and it allows the user to actually change the LLM by using the drop-down. Whomever maintains this plugin could learn a thing or two from how the VS Code implementation works.
Good so far,
Best plugin i use so far

I've just discovered that this plugin is a reason for key mapping changed for closing for example diff window on my MacBook. ESC does not work. Very annoying. It forced me to remove whole /Library/Application Support/JetBrains/WebStorm2024.3. Painful if it happens in the middle of a working day.
The Tab Completion feature displays garbled characters, especially when Chinese characters are involved. However, the content appears normal after pressing Tab.

Best update 1.5.37-242 for plugin so for, they have fixed the problem of full line code completion (now we can disable the code completion of github and use the inbuilt code completion of intelliJ IDE) and added all the model of github copilot of VSCode. Thanks for this update i always wanted to use inbuilt code completion of IDE and copilot simultaneously with different ai model.
Please add more models for completions.
为什么聊天内只有复制代码块和在光标出粘贴，如果聊天里面涉及到多个代码块或多个页面的代码块呢，怎么一键插入呢？这个功能不能做吗？
Claude 3.7 sonnet is on, and I finally pay attention to it, and I hope to optimize the experience in the future
The code suggestion will have garbled characters if it contains Chinese.

Latest update broke closing diff windows with Esc key :/

Repro: Open git commit diff window. Try to close it with Esc. Not working.

Dear Github Copilot Team. Please start already testing your product before release. Every second update either breaks the IDE or copilot stops working. This is horrible, how long does it have to go on like this?

Thanks to the developers for the cool update! Copilot completions from scratch has fallen off!

Finally, the plugin is now usable! It is now possible to choose GPT-4o as the model for smart completions. However, I would like to be able to choose another model, such as Claude. It would also be great if it could be integrated into the terminal.

It's usable and certainly helpful, however there are some issues that I noticed: First of all, great that we can now select Claude sonnet as LLM of choice, however setting it as a target LLM doesn't persist it after IDE restart. 2nd - We need that LLM as an option for code completion suggestions as well. GPT turbo is not the best for it I recon.
Thanks for adding other models in the plugin.

It's still lagging behind VSCode plugin in terms of features, but the amount of newly added features in the last few weeks makes very optimistic again! Thank you for adding the model selection!

Two biggest issues so far:

  1. The plugin still uses deprecated API that causes built-in full-line completion in IDEA to be disabled
  2. Autocompletion model list only consists of one model - GPT 3.5 Turbo, despite other models being enabled in the copilot configuration on the website (and I enabled Claude more than a week ago)
Why doesn't this plugin have the same features of vscode extensions? there is no copilot edit(agent) and other, so sad! is there any date to be available?
